# init(_:dataHandler:)

**Initializer**

Creates a new electrocardiogram query object.

## Declaration

```swift
convenience init(_ ecg: HKElectrocardiogram, dataHandler: @escaping (HKElectrocardiogramQuery, HKElectrocardiogramQuery.Result) -> Void)
```

## Parameters

- **ecg**: The electrocardiogram sample whose voltages you want to access.
- **dataHandler**: A block that the query calls repeatedly to return the voltage data. The handler takes the following parameters:



## Discussion

When you run the query, it calls the data handler once for each voltage measurement, passing a [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKElectrocardiogramQuery/Result/measurement(_:)] instance that contains the voltage data. After it has sent all the voltage measurements, it calls the data handler one last time, passing [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKElectrocardiogramQuery/Result/done]. If an error occurs, it stops collecting voltage data and passes [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKElectrocardiogramQuery/Result/error(_:)] instead.
